channel.description: True victory is not beating someone strong but being able to protect something important to you

item.title: (Shifted from Jan.31) Email file names are generated from special data
item.description:
What have been done:

  1. (Shifted from Jan.31) Email file names can now be generated from special data.

Note:

  1. E.g. of JPA format used in the program: 
     @Query("{\"status\" : { $ne: \"INCOMPLETE\"} }")
 List<Special> excludeIncompletes(Status status);

item.title: Fixed the null properties issues for Special import
item.description:
What have been done:

  1. Fixed the issue where Specials have lots of null properties caused by the empty constructor used to avoid Lombok default mapping.

Problems encountered:

  1. It’s difficult to control which properties need to be constructed and how they behave using Lombok. Properties will become null if we don’t specify them in an constructor with @Builder annotation.

Solution:

  1. Write our own SpecialBuilder class, instead of using Lombok. Eg. 
    public class Special {
 public static class SpecialBuilder {
     private String description;
     ...
 }
 ...
}

item.title: Fixed Thymeleaf parsing error on single quotation mark
item.description:
What have been done:

  1. Fixed Thymeleaf parsing error on single quotation mark. Use ' to escape ‘ in a string in Thymeleaf.
  2. Enriched emails with dates from specials.

item.title: Updated email template and fixed a bug causing error to save special to DB
item.description:
What have been done:

  1. Updated email html template from Oscar.
  2. Fixed the exception where Clock used in Special class cannot be saved into MongoDB.

Problems encountered:

  1. Exception triggered while saving Special class to DB: “Can’t find a codec for class java.time.Clock$SystemClock.”.

Solution:

  1. Use the annotation @Transient on the Clock property to prevent Spring Framework mapping
  2. Use the annotation @Builder on an empty contructor to prevent Lombok automatic mapping. Refer to link below:
    https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30717640/how-to-exclude-property-from-lombok-builder

item.title: Annual leave
item.description:
What have been done:

  1. Annual leave. Happy Chinese New Year.

item.title: Fixed a Thymeleaf parsing exception
item.description:
What have been done:

  1. Fixed a Thymeleaf parsing exception which says “Could not parse as expression”.
    It was caused by missing the “th:” scope in the html template.

item.title: Product branding
item.description:
What have been done:

  1. Discussed the product branding with a professional branding consultant.
    It was done by a small game with about 50 cards. Each card has two sides with a word on each that has opposite meaning to the other side. We need to categorize all cards into 3 categories, “what it is”, “what it is NOT” and “N/A”. Eventually we need to narrow down the top 4 words in each category. In the example of “Happy Gigs”, top 5 characteristics of it are “effortless”, “current”, “progressive”, “vibrant” and “welcoming”.
